snippet: The Muslim cleric who had expressed anger at a Christian girl’s alleged desecration of sacred Muslim texts has been accused by a colleague of falsifying evidence.
abstract: Muslim cleric Mohammad Khalid Chisti, who is at the forefront of a campaign in Pakistan to prosecute Christian girl Rimsha Masih for blasphemy, is accused by a colleague of falsifying evidence of burned holy papers; surprise arrest may change the direction of a case that has brought the world's attention to Pakistan's controversial blasphemy laws, which critics say are regularly used to exploit and intimidate minorities.
lead_paragraph: The Muslim cleric who had expressed anger at a Christian girl’s alleged desecration of sacred Muslim texts has been accused by a colleague of falsifying evidence.
